basic_info.official_name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)
basic_info.provider: Government of Ireland, Irish Higher Education Authority (HEA)

funding_info.funding_details: 60 scholarships awarded annually for one year of full-time study. Each scholarship is valued at €10,000 and includes a full tuition fee waiver from the host institution.
covered_expenses: monthly stipend for student costs and living expenses

timeline_info.opening_date: Call for applications for the 2025/2026 academic year is open (specific opening date not provided)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding non-EU/EEA students (citizens of countries other than the United Kingdom, Switzerland, the European Union, or the European Economic Area). Applicants must not have previously held a GOI-IES scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD programmes (NFQ levels 9 or 10)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale, or minimum 70% (A-grade for best chances)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree (implied prerequisite for postgraduate study)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience (considered in selection process, 40 marks)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS: Minimum score requirements range from 5.0 (no band lower than 6.0) to 7.0; TOEFL: Minimum score of 88-90; Other ELP tests like PTE, DET are accepted.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must have a conditional or final offer of admission to an eligible Irish higher education institution for a full-time, international, fee-paying postgraduate programme of at least one year's duration. Strong motivation for studying in Ireland and familiarity with Irish culture/way of life/academic importance are considered.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts, recommendation letters, personal statements, passport, offer letter from an eligible Irish HEI, marksheet. Official documents include: GOI-IES Call Document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, Application Help Document.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on academic qualifications, achievements, work experience (40 marks), and personal statement (refer to Candidate profile). A Selection Process Infographic is available.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious initiative funded by the Government of Ireland in partnership with Irish higher education institutions (HEIs) and managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA), aimed at attracting top-level international students to study in Ireland.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for the 2025/2026 academic year.

basic_info.provider: Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded. Stipend of 900-1000 euros per month or 8100-9000 euros per year. Some sources indicate partial fee coverage with an 8100 euro annual grant. Scholarships can be 3, 6, or 9 months long, renewable for multi-year courses. 9-month scholarships are available for Master's, AFAM, PhD, and research projects. 3-month scholarships are exclusively for advanced courses in Italian language and culture.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be foreign students not residing in Italy or Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Italian residents are not eligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor's Degree, Master's Degree, PhD programs, AFAM programs (arts, music, and dance), research under academic supervision, specialization and vocational schools, Italian language and culture courses. Fields include science, art, economics, engineering, culture.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Cannot hold another Italian government scholarship.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: For bachelor's programs: Minimum GPA of 3.0 or 75% aggregate in 10+2. For master's programs: Minimum 7.5/10 CGPA in a related undergraduate degree. Selection is based on academic merit/performance.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Appropriate academic qualification for the chosen program. Bachelor's degree for Master's programs, Master's degree for Doctoral programs.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Italian A2 (CEFR) for Italian language and culture courses. Italian B2 (CEFR) for Italian-taught programs. Evidence of English proficiency for English-taught programs.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Reference letters from teachers or professors (two required).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Motivation letter/essay explaining career goals and how the scholarship will help.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Bachelor’s Degree: ≤ 23 years old. Master’s Degree, AFAM programs, Italian Language/Culture courses: ≤ 28 years old (born after May 16, 1996). PhD: ≤ 30 years old. Age limits may have exceptions for renewals.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Age limits may have exceptions for renewals.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Academic achievements. Portfolio (if requested). Personal criteria.

background_and_logistics.official_website: Study in Italy portal (e.g., Study in Italy, universitaly.it/borse-studio).
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form, motivation letter/essay, reference letters, research project summary (for research/PhD).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection committee appointed by the Italian Embassy in each country. Based on academic merit, motivation, language proficiency, and other personal criteria.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Aims to strengthen international cultural and scientific cooperation, promote the Italian language and higher education system, and facilitate cultural exchange for international students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For the 2025-2026 academic year. 9-month scholarships from November 1, 2025, to July 31, 2026. 3-month scholarships for language/culture courses from January 1 to September 30, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship is described as fully funded by multiple sources. It provides funding of up to 58800 RMB annually. Specific stipends mentioned include CNY 1700/month (Master), CNY 2000/month, and 3000-3500 CNY/month (for Nankai University). It also covers comprehensive insurance worth CNY 800/year and a one-time allowance of CNY 800 for new students. Tuition and dormitory are covered for some programs (e.g., Nankai University). Some sources indicate a scholarship amount of 10,000 CNY for Master's and Doctoral degrees, which may represent a specific award level or partial funding.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Application deadlines vary by host institution and program: June 20, 2025 (general); February 15, 2025 (Nankai University); June 30, 2025 (Tianjin Normal University); May 31, 2025 (general). The scholarship is offered annually, with mentions for 2025 and 2026 intakes.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: The scholarship is open to international students (non-Chinese citizens) who are in good mental and physical health. Applicants must be self-funded international students applying for undergraduate, master's, or doctoral programs at eligible Higher Education Institutions in Tianjin. It is open for both prospective students and current students at Tianjin University and can be applied for year by year. The scholarship aims to reward students with academic excellence. There are no country restrictions mentioned.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Scholarships are available for undergraduate, master's, and PhD programs. They specifically support students pursuing degrees in fields aligned with Tianjin's local development goals. Chemical Engineering at Tianjin University is explicitly mentioned as an eligible Master's program.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: High School applicants: Minimum average of 80% or above. College/University applicants: Minimum GPA of 3.0 or above. For English-taught MBA Program at Tianjin University: GPA above 3.2/4.0.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Scholarships are available for undergraduate, master's, and PhD programs. Applicants for master's or PhD programs must have a bachelor's degree or higher.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum one year of relevant work experience is required for the English-taught MBA Program at Tianjin University. Some general contexts for higher degrees mention at least three years of work experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Chinese-instructed programs: HSK-5 certificate with a minimum score of 180 (or HSK4 (180+) for Engineering/Science, HSK5 (180+) for liberal arts). For English-instructed programs: English Proficiency Certificates are required. Specifically for English-taught MBA at Tianjin University: IELTS 6.5 or TOEFL 85. Applicants must meet the language requirements of the higher education institutions and provide relevant proofs. Some sources claim 'NO IELTS' for certain programs/universities.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two Recommendation Letters (from two different referrers) are required for Master's or PhD applicants.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Required documents include a notarized academic transcript in Chinese and English, a Study and Work Experience Resume since High School to present (with uninterrupted start and end times and clear education levels), an Original No Crime Certificate, a Physical Examination Report and Test Report (Original Copy), and a passport with a validity period of six months or more. All documents must be in English or Chinese. Personal statements should use clear and concise language.

background_and_logistics.official_website: Official information is primarily found on university-specific websites: sie.tju.edu.cn (Tianjin University), fao.tjus.edu.cn (Tianjin University of Science and Technology), gjjl.tjnu.edu.cn (Tianjin Normal University), en.nankai.edu.cn (Nankai University), tju.ciss.org.cn (Tianjin University Chemical Engineering). General information can also be found at studyintianjin.com.
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Applicants need to submit the Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form (either online or a downloadable form), an Application Form for Foreigners Wishing to Study at Tianjin University, an Admission Letter, an Application Form for Visa to China for Overseas Students (JW202 or JW201), a Physical Examination Report and Test Report (Original Copy), a passport with a validity period of six months or more, an Original No Crime Certificate, HSK/English Proficiency Certificates, notarized academic transcripts in Chinese and English, two Recommendation Letters, and a Study and Work Experience Resume. For Nankai University, an online application for international students and payment of the application fee are required.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants must first pass the international student review at the respective university and be pre-admitted to be eligible for nomination for the scholarship. Admission results are typically announced on university websites (e.g., Tianjin University announces from July 1 to August 31). The assessment results are publicized for one week before being submitted to the Tianjin Municipal Education Commission, which then determines the final scholarship list based on expert evaluation.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship is a one-year duration scholarship. It is open for both prospective students and current students at participating universities (e.g., Tianjin University) and can be applied for year by year.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship is offered annually, with application periods and deadlines varying by host institution, generally falling between December and June for the following academic year (e.g., 2025-2026).

basic_info.provider: Government of Colombia (coordinated by ICETEX - Colombian Institute of Educational Credit and Technical Studies Abroad)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Offers comprehensive financial support.
covered_expenses: Monthly stipends (equivalent to three Colombian legal monthly minimum wages)
One-time grant for the issuance of a foreign identification card

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be international students/foreign citizens. Not have Colombian nationality or dual nationality (Colombian). Not residing or having started postgraduate studies in Colombia. Not have resided in Colombia for the last 6 months prior to applying for the scholarship. Not having been a beneficiary of ICETEX through the Beca Colombia program in previous calls. Have a professional or bachelor's degree. Meet academic, language, and documentation requirements. Be admitted to at least one (and up to three) eligible programs at a participating public or private higher education institution in Colombia. High-achieving international students with exceptional academic merit and leadership are sought. Open to citizens of all countries.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s, Ph.D., and Specialization degree scholarships across a variety of degrees and academic disciplines. Programmes are offered by accredited Colombian higher education institutions. Priority areas include scientific research, technology, and innovation.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum cumulative undergraduate GPA equivalent to 4.0 out of 5.0 on the Colombian scale
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s, Ph.D., and Specialization degree programs. Applicants must have a professional or bachelor's degree.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least one year of professional experience
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience in the study's field

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Demonstrate proficiency in Spanish (reading, writing, and speaking) if required. Meet language requirements.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recent academic letter of reference from a university professor where the applicant finished his/her bachelor degree. Letters of recommendation (if required).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Verified copies of Educational Transcripts / University certificate- transcript (English/Spanish) certifying the average grade point of the applicant in bachelor degree. Professional Experience Certificate (at least one year). Recent academic letter of reference. Document confirming that the applicant hasn’t been living in Colombia prior to applying. Proof of admission to an eligible program.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Students are selected with exceptional academic merit and leadership. Candidates are evaluated based on requirements and scores; not chosen if requirements are not met, required score is not achieved, or no vacancy in the academic program is obtained.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Also known as the 'Beca Colombia Scholarship Programme for Foreigners'. It is part of Colombia’s Reciprocity Programme, designed to promote academic, cultural, and technological exchange and strengthen social ties. No application fee is required. The application process is completely online. Scholarship duration: up to 12 or 18 months for specialization, up to 24 months (4 academic semesters) for Master's, and up to 36 months for Doctorate. Scholarships are awarded on an annual term; for programs longer than 12 months, scholars must request an extension for subsequent years, subject to ICETEX requirements (e.g., extension request letter, transcript with minimum 4.0/5.0 GPA, experience report, university certificate of enrollment, proof of studies in Colombian territory). No extensions will be approved to continue the scholarship period initially granted if the program duration is already covered.

funding_info.funding_details: The Master Mind scholarship amounts to €10 000 for the 2024-2025 academic year and €10 000 for the 2025-2026 academic year. The Master Mind Scholarship includes a €10,020 grant and tuition waiver. €10,000 annual grant to cover living expenses and study costs. Full tuition fee waiver at KU Leuven or other participating Flemish institutions. The Master Mind Scholarship comes with an award of €8400 and a year’s worth of tuition fees. Described as Fully Funded.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 27th April 2025 (for 2025 cycle); 15 January 2026, 23.59 CET (for 2026-2027 cycle, KU Leuven and general); March 15, 2026 (23:59 GMT+1) (for 2026 cycle); UAntwerp application deadline was 1 February, 2025 (for 2025-2026, closed).
timeline_info.opening_date: 15 October 2025 (for 2026-2027 cycle); in November (general); next call announced in December 2025 (UAntwerp).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: up to 45 scholarships (5 reserved for American students); 30 Master Mind Scholarships (for 2026 cycle).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from all countries. Applicant must apply to take up a Master’s degree program at a Flemish higher education institution. Must be accepted by the host institution for a degree program to receive the scholarship, even if the decision is taken after scholarship selection. International students who have been on credit mobility in a hosting Flemish higher education institution are still eligible. The previous degree (used to enrol for the master program) cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution. Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution cannot apply. Must provide proof of admission to a master's program at a university in Flanders or Brussels. An official letter of acceptance issued by the Education and Student Administration Office at the VUB is needed before one can apply for the scholarship (VUB specific).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's programs in three main fields: Humanities and Social Sciences, Science, Engineering.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Various study fields are offered, visit each university website for eligible study programmes.

experience_requirements.min_years: solid two years of professional experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS: minimum overall score of 7 (or 7.0 overall band score); Cambridge CPE: minimum level C2; TOEFL: minimum total score of 94; C1 level of the Common European Framework. Online language tests like IELTS Indicator and TOEFL iBT Special Home Edition are also accepted. Students must have the ability to write and speak English.

additional_requirements.age_limits: age limit of 35–45 years for master's applicants (Facebook group); Age limit for Masters students is 30 years by the time of application (another Facebook group).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: 5 scholarships are reserved exclusively for American students.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: The Host institution also performs an academic check of the student’s file.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Curriculum Vitae (CV) (including American GPA, publications, academic awards, previous scholarships); Passport photograph; National ID or passport; Transcripts/records; Letter of motivation; Two letters (reference letters); KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (as an annexe for KU Leuven); Official letter of acceptance issued by the Education and Student Administration Office (VUB specific); Bank details (name, BIC/SWIFT, IBAN/bank account number, name of account holder).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The Host institution starts the application procedure by creating the candidate’s application file in the Mobility-Online tool. Students are not able to apply before being preselected by the master programme coordinator. If preselected, students receive an email generated by the Mobility-Online tool. Following the application deadline, master's programmes will nominate eligible students. The International Relations Office will screen all files and submit a shortlist (e.g., maximum 20 students for UGent) to the Flemish Government who makes the final decision. Shortlisted students are contacted by the university’s International Office with necessary information to complete their online Master Mind scholarship application in the Mobility Online tool.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Lasts one year for 60 ECTS or two for 120 ECTS, and cannot be combined with other scholarships.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application start in November; Applications open 15 October 2025 (for 2026-2027); Application deadline 15 January 2026 (KU Leuven) or March 15, 2026; Nomination by host institution follows application deadline; Online Application Invitation April 2026; Final Submission (implied after invitation). The call for 2025-2026 has closed, next call announced December 2025 (UAntwerp).

basic_info.provider: Thailand International Cooperation Agency (TICA), Thai Government, Thai Universities/Academic Institutions

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded Scholarships, 100% tuition coverage, full funding with stipends, full scholarships covering travel, accommodation and subsistence expenses.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from developing countries/partners. Must not be a Thai citizen. Candidates must be nominated by the National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation (e.g., Ministry of Foreign Affairs) or relevant central government agencies in an eligible country/territory. Applicants should be working in the government sector or in areas related to the course provided. Civil servants must fulfill BCSR 2023 criteria. Applicants outside civil service (Corporate, Private Sector, NGO, etc.) must fulfill criteria prescribed by the Department of Workforce Planning and Skills Development, MoESD. Scholarships are allocated for specific member states. Relevant Governmental Agencies of OIC Member States are requested to nominate up to five (5) candidates per course.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's Degree programs in diverse fields aligning with Thailand’s expertise and global development goals, including: Sufficiency Economy Philosophy (SEP), Climate Change and Environmental Issues, Agriculture and Food Security, Public Health, Bio-Circular-Green Economy Model (BCG), and other topics related to Sustainable Development Goals. Specific examples include: Occupational and Environmental Health, Primary Health Care Management, Parasitology, Tropical Medicine, Science.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Master's: Bachelor's degree with 3.2 GPA minimum.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s degree (to pursue a Master's Degree).

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum 2-3 years of work experience with the nominating agency at the time of application.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Working in the government sector or in areas related to the course provided, or with the nominating agency (Corporate, Private Sector, NGO, etc.).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Good command of English required. English test scores (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS) as required by the academic institution. Postgraduate IELTS score of 6.5 - 7.0 overall is a typical range.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation Letter from at least 2 persons (1 person per letter), e.g., from university.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants are advised to clearly define short-term and long-term goals, being specific about achievements and plans.
additional_requirements.age_limits: No more than 45 years of age.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Good physical and mental condition, must not be pregnant.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Relevant qualification requirements, relevant current work, academic standards.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: TIPP application form (downloadable from TICA website), hard copy of application form and other related documents submitted through the Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission, English test score (if required by institution), other documents as required by the academic institution.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Introduced in 2000 as a framework for providing postgraduate scholarships for developing partners. Aims to build global partnerships, empower students with advanced skills and knowledge, and provide opportunities to exchange experiences and best practices for sustainable development. Allows participants to experience Thailand’s rich culture and warm hospitality. It is an annual program.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Annual program, with courses listed for TIPP 2019-2028.
